position_description_html:
Job Description

Duties


Tourism Division is a division within Austrade encompassing both Tourism Research Australia (TRA) and Tourism Policy and Operations (TPO). TRA is responsible for producing strategic research and statistics on tourism to inform government and industry decision-making and TPO is responsible for tourism policy development and implementation, including coordinating and leading implementation of Tourism 2020 initiatives, to maintain and promote a competitive tourism sector.
The Outreach and Stakeholder Support team plays a key role managing the quality control, design, accessibility and useability of all TRA products, leading Tourism Division’s stakeholder engagement and communication activities and coordinating the Destination Visitor Survey (DVS) program
Key responsibilities of the Manager, Outreach and Stakeholder Support position include:
• Delivering divisional stakeholder engagement and communications strategies.
• Delivering strategically focused regional research through the DVS program and other products that have national relevance and informs policy development, planning and program development.


Eligibility


The successful applicant must be an Australian citizen and have, or be willing to undergo a security clearance to the level of Baseline as a condition of employment.

Notes


RecruitAbility applies to this vacancy. Under the RecruitAbility scheme you will be invited to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under the scheme; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the job. For more information see: http://www.apsc.gov.au/priorities/disability/recruitability .
notes_html:
Applicants to vacancies notified in all formats of the electronic Public Service Gazette should be aware that;
.  the names of successful applicants may also be notified in all formats of the electronic Public Service Gazette
.  applicants found suitable may be offered similar employment opportunities by other Australian Public Service agencies
This notice is part of the electronic Public Service Gazette PS50-Thu - 15 Dec 2016 Published by Australian Public Service Commission.
